title: Zelensky meets with Nazarbayev in Tokyo, invites him to Ukraine
title_en: Zelensky meets with Nazarbayev in Tokyo, invites him to Ukraine
text:
Zelensky meets with Nazarbayev in Tokyo, invites him to Ukraine
22.10.2019 13:56
President of Ukraine Volodymyr Zelensky met with the first President of Kazakhstan Nursultan Nazarbayev during the working visit to Japan, according to the Ukrainian president’s official website.
“During his visit to Japan, President of Ukraine Volodymyr Zelensky met with the first President of Kazakhstan Nursultan Nazarbayev. Nursultan Nazarbayev congratulated the head of Ukrainian state on his election success,” reads the report.
The parties discussed the current situation in occupied territories of Donbas and Crimea.
According to Nazarbayev, Kazakhstan supports the territorial integrity and sovereignty of Ukraine.
The parties also discussed "positive changes in the promotion of peace, in particular, the return of prisoners and the resumption of diplomatic negotiations, and stressed the need for talks in the Normandy format be held as soon as possible".
The issue of increasing trade between Ukraine and Kazakhstan was also raised during the meeting.
“We all need a dialogue. Our territories are important. These are the lands of our ancestors and, I am sure, of our children,” the Ukrainian president said.
Also, Zelensky invited Nazarbayev to visit to Ukraine.
On October 21-24, President Vladimir Zelensky paid a working visit to Japan to attend the Emperor's enthronement ceremony.
As reported, President Volodymyr Zelensky on October 21-24 is on an official visit in Japan where he attended the ceremony of enthronement of the Japanese emperor.
Top news
text_en:
Zelensky meets with Nazarbayev in Tokyo, invites him to Ukraine
22.10.2019 13:56
President of Ukraine Volodymyr Zelensky met with the first President of Kazakhstan Nursultan Nazarbayev during the working visit to Japan, according to the Ukrainian president’s official website.
“During his visit to Japan, President of Ukraine Volodymyr Zelensky met with the first President of Kazakhstan Nursultan Nazarbayev. Nursultan Nazarbayev congratulated the head of Ukrainian state on his election success,” reads the report.
The parties discussed the current situation in occupied territories of Donbas and Crimea.
According to Nazarbayev, Kazakhstan supports the territorial integrity and sovereignty of Ukraine.
The parties also discussed "positive changes in the promotion of peace, in particular, the return of prisoners and the resumption of diplomatic negotiations, and stressed the need for talks in the Normandy format be held as soon as possible".
The issue of increasing trade between Ukraine and Kazakhstan was also raised during the meeting.
“We all need a dialogue. Our territories are important. These are the lands of our ancestors and, I am sure, of our children,” the Ukrainian president said.
Also, Zelensky invited Nazarbayev to visit to Ukraine.
On October 21-24, President Vladimir Zelensky paid a working visit to Japan to attend the Emperor's enthronement ceremony.
As reported, President Volodymyr Zelensky on October 21-24 is on an official visit in Japan where he attended the ceremony of enthronement of the Japanese emperor.

title: Latest news
text:
Ukrainian multimedia platform for broadcasting
Friday, 21 January 2022, 16:35
Latest news
Ukraine has secured the European Commission’s support for its efforts to synchronize its national power system with the European Union's ENTSOE and is moving steadily toward completing the process in 2023.
14:53
The United Kingdom has sent a group of around 30 elite troops and 2,000 anti-tank missile launchers to Ukraine amid fears of a new Russian invasion.
14:40
Warsaw is looking into providing military assistance to Kyiv. The issue is being discussed in Vistula, Poland, by the presidents of Ukraine and Poland, Volodymyr Zelensky and Andrzej Duda.
14:00
Russia may try to seize some Ukrainian territories under the pretext of "protecting" the Russian-speaking population, in particular Kharkiv, which "will be the beginning of a large-scale war," Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky has said.
12:54
Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky has said that he supports the introduction of sanctions against Russia now, before its potential invasion of Ukraine.
12:30
Erdogan seeks to arrange Zelensky-Putin summit as soon as possible
Turkish President Recep Tayyip Erdogan hopes he will succeed in putting the presidents of Ukraine and Russia at the negotiation table as soon as possible and thus promote a peaceful settlement of tensions arising from the threat of Russian aggression against Ukraine.
12:13
Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky has thanked the Polish people and President Andrzej Duda for their support of Ukraine, adding that both countries are working together to address security challenges in the region.
11:50
The United States has pressed formal aircraft piracy charges against members of the Belarusian regime involved in the forcible landing in Minsk of a Ryanair flight carrying an opposition journalist aimed to arrest the latter.
11:31
More than 86,000 people have been vaccinated against COVID-19 in Ukraine over the past 24 hours, the Ukrainian Health Ministry has said on Facebook.
11:10
The Canadian military training mission UNIFIER, operating in Ukraine, will be extended for another six months.
10:40
Territorial Defense Forces, together with other units of the Armed Forces, will conduct at least five military exercises involving mobilized reservists.
10:29
Foreign Secretary Liz Truss has warned Russia that invading Ukraine would lead to a terrible loss of life like the Soviet takeover of Afghanistan.
10:14
Spain has sent warships to join NATO naval forces in the Mediterranean and the Black Sea as tension in the region rises over the Russian military build-up on the Ukrainian border.
10:00
The Czech Ministry of Defense seeks to support Ukraine by providing artillery munitions to the Ukrainian Armed Forces.
09:46
The White House will discuss the next foreign policy steps on Russia after U.S. Secretary of State Antony Blinken returns from Geneva after talks with his Russian counterpart Sergei Lavrov.
09:20
On January 20, Russian occupation forces violated the ceasefire five times in the zone of the Joint Forces Operation.
09:11
The U.S. Department of the Treasury has imposed sanctions against four Ukrainian politicians engaged in Russian government-directed influence activities to destabilize Ukraine, according to a statement posted on the agency's website on January 20.
09:05
Over the last day, January 20, a total of 20,156 new COVID-19 cases were confirmed across Ukraine.
08:46
Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky and Polish President Andrzej Duda have discussed security challenges, removing obstacles in the transport sphere and strengthening energy cooperation.
20 January 2022
Bill imposing sanctions on Putin, excluding Russia from SWIFT tabled in U.S. Congress
Republican Congressman Jim Banks has introduced in the U.S. House of Representatives a bill entitled "To impose sanctions with respect to the Russian Federation, and for other purposes," which, among other things, provides for Russia's exclusion from the SWIFT international payment system.
17:40
The Association Agreement with the European Union is Ukraine’s roadmap for reforms and the basis for integration into the EU's internal market.
17:01
President of the Swiss Confederation Ignazio Cassis hopes to achieve tangible practical results for Ukraine's stability and prosperity at the 5th Ukraine Reform Conference in Lugano.
16:46
Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky and Polish President Andrzej Duda are holding a face-to-face meeting at the Polish leader's residence in Wisla.
16:33
Ukraine plans to attract foreign investment in energy to achieve the goals of energy independence and decarbonization.
16:14
Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky has said he hopes that talks with Russia will help de-escalate the situation on the border with Ukraine and the Russian leadership will guarantee peace in the Donetsk and Luhansk regions.
16:00
The National Bank has downgraded its economic growth forecast for 2022 from 3.8% to 3.4%.
15:36
The National Bank of Ukraine has decided to raise its key interest rate to 10%.
15:14
The Embassy of the Republic of Korea in Ukraine expressed interest in the Ukrainian-Korean cooperation in the field of space exploration and agreed to continue the partnership with the State Space Agency of Ukraine (SSAU).
14:43
Ukrainian Foreign Minister Dmytro Kuleba has said he is ready for a trilateral meeting with U.S. Secretary of State Antony Blinken and Russian Foreign Minister Sergei Lavrov if the Russian side agrees to this meeting.
1

title: Zelensky arrives in Brussels
text: Zelensky arrives in Brussels 04.06.2019 16:14 Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky has arrived on a working visit to Brussels, Ukraine's Presidential Administration has reported on Twitter. "Volodymyr Zelensky has arrived in Brussels where he will have a number of top-level meetings," the report said. According to the administration, the president promised to remind Ukraine's friends in Europe of hundreds of children killed and wounded in Donbas, urging Russia to stop the war. Zelensky's working visit to EU and NATO institutions in Brussels will last for two days. op Duda: Poland to support granting Ukraine EU candidate status While citing and using any materials on the Internet, links to the website ukrinform.net not lower than the first paragraph are mandatory. In addition, citing the translated materials of foreign media outlets is possible only if there is a link to the website ukrinform.net and to the website of a foreign media outlet. Citing and using materials in offline media, mobile apps, Smart TV are allowed only with written permission from Ukrinform. News and publications marked as "Advertisement" and "PR" and articles in the section "Releases" include promoted content, and an advertiser is responsible for the content. © 2015-2022 Ukrinform. title: Ukraine, Moldova to create Presidential Council – Zelensky
title_en: Ukraine, Moldova to create Presidential Council – Zelensky
text: Ukraine, Moldova to create Presidential Council – Zelensky 12.01.2021 14:55 Ukraine and Moldova have agreed to create a Presidential Council to address issues of bilateral relations, President Volodymyr Zelensky says. He announced this after the signing of bilateral documents with President of Moldova Maia Sandu in Kyiv on Tuesday, an Ukrinform correspondent reports. The event took place without the participation of the media outlets; it was broadcast live on the Facebook page of the head of the Ukrainian state. "We decided to create a Presidential Council, within which we will format the strategy and coordinate our actions to address the tasks of the bilateral agenda," Zelensky said. In addition, the two presidents intend to resume the dialogue at the highest level and make it dynamic and effective. According to Zelensky, the priorities of the joint "economic impulse" will be energy, infrastructure, transport and transit. President of Moldova Maia Sandu arrived on her first official visit in Kyiv on January 12, 2021. ish
text_en: Ukraine, Moldova to create Presidential Council – Zelensky 12.01.2021 14:55 Ukraine and Moldova have agreed to create a Presidential Council to address issues of bilateral relations, President Volodymyr Zelensky says. He announced this after the signing of bilateral documents with President of Moldova Maia Sandu in Kyiv on Tuesday, an Ukrinform correspondent reports. The event took place without the participation of the media outlets; it was broadcast live on the Facebook page of the head of the Ukrainian state. "We decided to create a Presidential Council, within which we will format the strategy and coordinate our actions to address the tasks of the bilateral agenda," Zelensky said. In addition, the two presidents intend to resume the dialogue at the highest level and make it dynamic and effective. According to Zelensky, the priorities of the joint "economic impulse" will be energy, infrastructure, transport and transit. President of Moldova Maia Sandu arrived on her first official visit in Kyiv on January 12, 2021. ish

title: U.S. Embassy in Ukraine stresses dangers posed by Russian propaganda
title_en: U.S. Embassy in Ukraine stresses dangers posed by Russian propaganda
text: U.S. Embassy in Ukraine stresses dangers posed by Russian propaganda 11.01.2022 13:00 The Embassy of the United States of America in Ukraine recalled of the dangers of propaganda circulated by the Russian Federation. The relevant video was posted by the U.S. Embassy on Twitter , Ukrinform reports. The video shows websites that debunk Russian propaganda myths. In particular, in one of the shots there is an infamous sham report of a "crucified boy" in Donbas, earlier aired on Russian television. The voice-over explains that Russia is now using the same propaganda tactics. "We’ve seen this gaslighting before. When Russia invaded Ukraine in 2014, it claimed that Ukraine was the aggressor, justifying pre-planned military action. And again, today, we see a significant effort to push propaganda against Ukraine, NATO, and the United States," the narrator said. Read also: Absurd to believe Ukraine threatens Russia - Blinken It should be recalled that since the onset of Russian aggression against Ukraine, several media projects have been created aimed to debunk myths and fake news spread by the Russian propaganda machine. Among such anti-propaganda platforms are StopFake, InformNapalm, and others. Part of the video posted by the U.S. Embassy is in fact based on the said platforms’ materials. As Ukrinform reported earlier, U.S. Deputy Secretary of State Wendy Sherman said that during the talks in Geneva, the Russian delegation assured that there were no plans to invade Ukraine, and that the movement of troops was about the exercises. im
text_en: U.S. Embassy in Ukraine stresses dangers posed by Russian propaganda 11.01.2022 13:00 The Embassy of the United States of America in Ukraine recalled of the dangers of propaganda circulated by the Russian Federation. The relevant video was posted by the U.S. Embassy on Twitter , Ukrinform reports. The video shows websites that debunk Russian propaganda myths. In particular, in one of the shots there is an infamous sham report of a "crucified boy" in Donbas, earlier aired on Russian television. The voice-over explains that Russia is now using the same propaganda tactics. "We’ve seen this gaslighting before. When Russia invaded Ukraine in 2014, it claimed that Ukraine was the aggressor, justifying pre-planned military action. And again, today, we see a significant effort to push propaganda against Ukraine, NATO, and the United States," the narrator said. Read also: Absurd to believe Ukraine threatens Russia - Blinken It should be recalled that since the onset of Russian aggression against Ukraine, several media projects have been created aimed to debunk myths and fake news spread by the Russian propaganda machine. Among such anti-propaganda platforms are StopFake, InformNapalm, and others. Part of the video posted by the U.S. Embassy is in fact based on the said platforms’ materials. As Ukrinform reported earlier, U.S. Deputy Secretary of State Wendy Sherman said that during the talks in Geneva, the Russian delegation assured that there were no plans to invade Ukraine, and that the movement of troops was about the exercises. im
